interface.name: liri_color_picker_manager
interface.description: This interface allows a client to read the ARGB value of a pixel, effectively pickup up the color at a specific coordinate of an output.

entry.name: already_constructed
entry.summary: a color picker for the same output already exist

entry.name: still_in_progress
entry.summary: another pick_interactive request is still in progress

request.name: pick_at_location

description.summary: pick a color at a specific output location

request.description: Pick the color of a pixel at specific coordinates within the bounds of the output.

request.name: pick_interactively
request.description:
Start a pointer-driven pixel selection. The user moves the mouse pointer to their desired location and press a mouse button.
This request fails if another interactive request is still in progress, regardless of what liri_color_picker object originated it and regardless of which output is involved.

request.name: destroy
request.description: All objects created by the manager will still remain valid, until their appropriate destroy request has been called.

interface.name: liri_color_picker
interface.description: This object is created in response to a color picker request. The picked event is emitted as soon as the operation is completed, and when that happens the client has to destroy the object.

event.name: picked
event.description: The ARGB color of the selected pixel is available.
